_meta.description: Risk disclosure questions for agricultural companies

sector_codes.P: Pesticides - Questions applicable to pesticide/crop protection companies
sector_codes.F: Fertilizers - Questions applicable to fertilizer companies
sector_codes.PF: Both - Questions applicable to both pesticides and fertilizers

canonical_questions.text: Does the company consider financial risks related to pesticide resistance?
Does the company consider financial risks related to soil degradation caused by its fertiliser products?
Does the company consider financial risks related to human health problems from its products?
Does the company consider financial risks related to carbon taxes?
Does the company consider financial risks related to reduced soil fertility caused by its pesticides?
Does the company consider financial risks related to factory workplace hazards including chemical exposure during production of pesticides?
Does the company consider financial risks related to drinking water contamination from leaching of applied products?
Does the company consider financial risks related to demand destruction as organic farming and alternatives gain market share?

Does the company consider financial risks related to waterway pollution and eutrophication from nutrient runoff when the company's products are applied by farmers? Do not consider factory sources of pollution.
canonical_questions.notes: Primary relevance: Fertilizer companies (nutrient runoff). For pesticide companies, see 99909-A variant.

canonical_questions.text: Does the company consider financial risks related to disposal of chemical waste, such as gypstacks?
canonical_questions.notes: Gypstacks are phosphogypsum waste stacks specific to phosphate fertilizer production.

canonical_questions.text: Does the company consider financial risks or liabilities related to restoration of mining sites?
canonical_questions.notes: Applicable to mining-based fertilizer companies (potash, phosphate rock). See 99913 for manufacturing site restoration.

canonical_questions.text: Does the company consider financial risks of increasing pesticide bans and restrictions reducing market access?
canonical_questions.notes: Covers broad regulatory restrictions on products.

canonical_questions.text: Does the company consider financial risks of technological developments such as new seeds requiring fewer pesticides/fertiliser?
canonical_questions.notes: Original question 99912 preserved - addresses long-term demand destruction from agricultural innovation (CRISPR, drought-resistant seeds, nitrogen-fixing crops).

canonical_questions.text: Does the company consider financial risks or liabilities related to restoration of contaminated manufacturing sites?
canonical_questions.notes: Covers chemical production facilities, not mining sites (see 99911 for mining).

canonical_questions.text: Does the company consider financial risks or liabilities related to loss of pollinators and beneficial insects, such as bees, from the use of its products due to ecosystem collapse?
canonical_questions.notes: CRITICAL for pesticide companies - neonicotinoid insecticides linked to pollinator decline.

canonical_questions.text: Does the company consider financial risks associated with rising compliance and testing costs for registration and re-registration?
canonical_questions.notes: Increasing regulatory burden for product approvals (EPA, EU REACH, etc.).

canonical_questions.text: Does the company consider financial risks related to negative public perception of chemical-intensive agriculture?
canonical_questions.notes: Reputational and market risk from ESG concerns, consumer preferences for 'natural' products.

canonical_questions.text: Does the company consider financial risks related to class action lawsuits and legal challenges from health/environmental claims?
canonical_questions.notes: Broad litigation risk covering product liability, environmental damage claims.

canonical_questions.text: Does the company consider financial risks related to high energy production processes and N2O emissions from field application?
canonical_questions.notes: Specific to nitrogen fertilizer production (energy-intensive Haber-Bosch process) and nitrous oxide emissions.

Syngenta.text: Does the company consider financial risks related to waterway pollution from pesticide runoff and contamination?
Syngenta.adaptation_reason: Adapted from 99909 to focus on pesticide runoff instead of nutrient runoff (fertilizer issue).

Syngenta.text: Does the company consider financial risks related to disposal of pesticide manufacturing waste and chemical byproducts?
Syngenta.adaptation_reason: Adapted from 99910 (gypstacks) to pesticide-specific chemical waste.

Syngenta.text: Does the company consider financial risks from specific pesticide active ingredient bans (e.g., atrazine, paraquat, chlorpyrifos, neonicotinoids)?
Syngenta.adaptation_reason: More specific than canonical 99912 - names actual banned/restricted Syngenta products.

Syngenta.text: Does the company consider financial risks from glyphosate litigation and related product liability lawsuits?
Syngenta.adaptation_reason: Specific variant of 99917 focusing on glyphosate (Roundup-style) litigation risk.
Syngenta.notes: Glyphosate litigation has resulted in multi-billion dollar settlements for competitors (Bayer/Monsanto). Highly material risk.

Syngenta.text: Does the company consider financial risks from paraquat litigation and related product liability lawsuits?
Syngenta.adaptation_reason: Specific variant for paraquat litigation (linked to Parkinson's disease claims).
Syngenta.notes: Syngenta is a major paraquat producer. Growing litigation similar to glyphosate pattern.

Syngenta.text: Does the company consider financial risks from GMO seed regulatory changes and approval delays in key markets?
Syngenta.adaptation_reason: Specific to Syngenta's seed business - GMO approval delays can lock products out of major markets (China, EU).
Syngenta.notes: This question previously identified the $1.51 billion Viptera settlement - KEEP THIS!

Syngenta.text: Does the company consider financial risks from neonicotinoid bans and restrictions on specific pesticide active ingredients affecting pollinator health?
Syngenta.adaptation_reason: More specific than canonical 99914 - focuses on regulatory response to pollinator decline (neonicotinoid bans in EU, etc.).
Syngenta.notes: Syngenta produces thiamethoxam and other neonicotinoids banned in EU. Major revenue impact.

Syngenta.text: Does the company consider financial risks related to high energy production processes and N2O emissions from nitrogen fertilizer manufacturing and field application (Haber-Bosch process)?
Syngenta.adaptation_reason: Enhanced with technical context (Haber-Bosch) for fertilizer companies.
Syngenta.notes: NOT APPLICABLE to Syngenta (pesticide company). Relevant for Nutrien, Yara, CF Industries.

Syngenta.text: Does the company consider financial risks from changing agricultural practices and consumer preferences toward organic/sustainable farming and biological pesticide alternatives?
Syngenta.adaptation_reason: More specific than canonical - emphasizes biological pesticides as direct competitive threat.

question_selection.description: How to select questions for a specific company analysis
steps: 2. Include ALL canonical questions matching company's sector (P, F, or PF)
3. Add company-specific variants from the variants section
4. Exclude questions explicitly marked as not applicable in company profile
5. Prioritize questions based on company profile's priority rankings

classification_scale.NONE: No disclosure found - company does not mention this risk
classification_scale.UNCLEAR: Risk is mentioned but no clear link to financial impact
classification_scale.PARTIAL: Company acknowledges financial risk but does not quantify
classification_scale.YES: Company discloses quantified financial risks (dollar amounts, ranges, provisions, settlements)

output_requirements.verbatim_extraction: Extract exact quotes from documents - do not paraphrase
output_requirements.source_citations: MUST include: Document name, Page number, Section title (from TOC if available)
output_requirements.financial_quantification: Extract ANY dollar amounts: settlements, provisions, reserves, estimated impacts, ranges, litigation values
output_requirements.classification_justification: Explain why you classified as NONE/UNCLEAR/PARTIAL/YES with specific evidence

environmental_health_focus.guidance: This analysis prioritizes ENVIRONMENTAL and HEALTH impacts over pure legal/regulatory outcomes. Look for:
environmental_indicators: Ecosystem damage (pollinator loss, aquatic toxicity, biodiversity)
Water contamination (drinking water, surface water, groundwater)
Waste and site contamination (manufacturing sites, disposal)
Climate/emissions impacts (N2O, energy use, carbon taxes)
health_indicators: Community health (drinking water contamination, air quality)
environmental_health_focus.search_beyond_litigation: Do not only look for settled lawsuits. Look for forward-looking risk disclosures about potential environmental/health impacts even if no litigation has occurred yet.
